title: conservation of energy and projectile motion

content.question: A small block is placed on a track at an initial height <math alttext="h sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math> above a horizontal table. The end of the track is inclined an angle <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>θ</mi></mstyle></math> above the horizontal, as shown in the figure. The block is released, slides down the track, up the incline, leaves the track, and reaches a maximum height <math alttext="h sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> before starting to fall back to the table. There is negligible friction between the block and track. The angle is changed to <math alttext="theta sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="theta is less than theta sub 1, which is less than 90 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>θ</mi><mo><</mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><mn>90</mn><mo>°</mo></mstyle></math>, and the block reaches a new maximum height <math alttext="h sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>. Which of the following correctly relates <math alttext="h sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="h sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="h sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and provides correct justification?

choices.label: <math alttext="h sub 0 equals h sub 1, which equals h sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, because mechanical energy is conserved.

<math alttext="h sub 0 equals h sub 1, which equals h sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, because the maximum height of the block is always equal to the initial height from which the block is released.

<math alttext="h sub 0 is greater than h sub 2, which is greater than h sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, because the increasing angle at which the block leaves the incline decreases the kinetic energy of the block when it is at its maximum height.

<math alttext="h sub 0 is greater than h sub 2, which is greater than h sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, because increasing the angle at which the block leaves the incline increases the amount of work the incline does on the block.

content.answer: <math alttext="h sub 0 is greater than h sub 2, which is greater than h sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>h</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, because the increasing angle at which the block leaves the incline decreases the kinetic energy of the block when it is at its maximum height.
